title: Integrate the factory-ts package
description:
A local package was created that is currently placed in `packages/factory-ts` relative to this project.
This package allows calling agents to run on specific projects, tasks and features. It needs to be integrated into this project so agents can be ran on specific tasks or features and agent performance can be monitored. This whole package was based on 3 python scripts that are palced under packages/factory-ts/blueprint

features.title: Add the local 'factory-ts' package into this project
features.description:
The package is located at `packages/factory-ts`
The factor-ts documentation is
`packages/factory-ts/FACTORY_TS_OVERVIEW.md` whereas the configuration documantion is: `packages/factory-ts/CONFIGURATION.md`

features.title: factory-ts orchestrator needs to mirror original python script
features.description:
orchestrator.ts should do EXACTLY the same as is the orchestrator flow inside run_local_agent.py
It must allow running agents on tasks or a task's specific feature until done or blocked.
Go over run_local_agent.py and make sure the functionality is mirrored exactly inside orchestrator.ts

features.title: factory-ts orchestrator.ts needs an implementation of a git manager
features.description:
orchestrator.ts is mirroring run_local_agent.py - which uses git_manager.py
The equivalent to git_manager.py needs to also exist inside factory-ts so that orchestrator.ts can use it.

features.title: factory-ts `orchestrator.ts` needs an implementation of a `CompletionClient`
features.description:
`orchestrator.ts` is mirroring `run_local_agent.py` - which uses a library `litellm` to communicate with LLMs.
The `orchestrator.ts` should be a self-contained library - just like `run_local_agent.py` was. If the correct configuration is passed to it, it should run the LLM conversations. Thus, it requires an equivalent of `litellm` locally to run.

features.title: factory-ts is the source of truth when it comes to Project,Task,Feature types
features.description: Integrate them inside this project meaning that 'src/types/tasks.ts' is no longer needed. All places where they were used must be updated.

features.title: Integrate the new `orchestrator.ts` (inside factory-ts) with `mainOrchestrator.ts`
features.description:
We need to be able to run agents using the new `orchestrator.ts` .
That file is based on `run_local_agent.py`which was part of a python project.
Look at `orchestrator.ts` - iron out any inconsistencies with regards to `run_local_agent.py` and make sure it is possible to call it all properly from within `mainOrchestrator.js` .

features.title: the new `orchestrator.ts` needs to gather statistics
features.description: `orchestrator.ts` needs to store all messages sent between itself and an LLM so that usage, performance and cost data can be gathered.

features.title: factory-ts `types.ts`, `taskUtils.ts`, `orchestrator.ts` have duplicate types
features.description: all duplicate types or interfaces need to be cleaned up
